abstract: Advocates for wild salmon say a deadly virus had been detected yet again in a Pacific salmon in British Columbia, although it was not clear whether a resistance had been developed; finding poses questions for the viability of salmon fisheries in North America, which appear to have aided spread of virus to wild fish.
snippet: Advocates for wild salmon said a deadly virus had been detected yet again in British Columbia, although it was not clear whether a resistance had been developed.
lead_paragraph: Advocates for wild salmon said a deadly virus had been detected yet again in British Columbia, although it was not clear whether a resistance had been developed.

headline.main: Virus in Pacific Salmon Raises Worries About Industry
headline.print_headline: Virus in Pacific Salmon Raises Worries About Industry
headline.seo: Pacific Salmon Virus Raises Worries About Industry
